The Bus Decoder component converts a 2 to 4-bit binary value on In to a true on one of four to sixteen output lines. The number of outputs is determined by the bit size and is configurable.

In this figure, a value of 4 (0b100) is decoded to a high on output O4, lighting the corresponding LED in an LED Bar. The Bus Decoder will also draw a line from the input to the corresponding activated output. If the input is out of range or undefined, the outputs are also undefined (?) and the line does not appear.
